snippet: President Obama's top aides said that Mitt Romney's choice of Paul D. Ryan as his running mate should make it easier for the president to run against the lawmakers who have blocked much of the White House agenda.
abstract: President Obama's top aides said that Mitt Romney's choice of Paul D. Ryan as his running mate should make it easier for the president to run against the lawmakers who have blocked much of the White House agenda.

headline.main: Through Ryan, Obama Seeks to Link Romney to Congress
